page.title: 07Wildlife -Mammals
page.content: { Badgers}are still very much in evidence in the area. Their sets and dung pits are a common sight and it is by no means rare to see them at dusk in certain places.{Foxes}too are common - even bold at times, being spotted in mid-afternoon on open ground and have been known to cause considerable damage to poultry etc. They are still{hunted}with horses and foxhounds. {Rabbits}cause damage to crops on the edge of fields adjacent to their burrows. These can be spotted easily when chalk spoil is excavated, sometimes positioned many metres into a field. These too are hunted, often after dark using a shotgun fired from a Landrover. Hares I have seen rarely. {Mole}hills can be found occasionally and{grey squirrels}too.
